p: Twenty-seven compounds were identified from the aroma of freeze-dried black morel, comprised 96.75% of the total aromas, and 1-octen-3-ol (68.61%) was the main component ( Figure 2(C)), which was similar with black morels grown in Israel [ 14]. Thirteen compounds were identified from the lipophilic extracts of freeze-dried black morel, comprised 94.27% of the total extracts, and linoleic acid (56.46%) were the main components.
